item.title: TikTok Goes Dark for U.S. Users, While Trump Signals He Will Save It
item.description: The app started halting service Saturday night for 170 million users in its most important market.

item.title: What Happens Now That TikTok's Gone Dark?
item.description: The company told users the app isn’t available and told them to stay tuned. Trump said he will likely intervene.

item.title: They Built Thriving Businesses on TikTok. The Ban Could Destroy Them.
item.description: The platform has provided a surge in discovery and revenue for companies that may not be able to replicate it elsewhere.

item.title: How a Little-Known Finnish Company Became One of the World's Hottest Gadget Startups
item.description: Oura’s smart ring measures heart health and can predict when you may be getting sick

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Find insight on data center real estate investment trusts, Cisco Systems, BCE and more in the latest Market Talks covering technology, media and telec...
